description:
Love this bar! Awesome place to watch sports games with great drinks and selections of beer! 
They make a killer Bloody Mary! 

The back of the bar has areas to hang out with extra TVs to watch games so you don't miss a beat.
Cool place to hang out with friends.. it's a gem! 

Recommend it!
author: Joseph J.

description:
Clean. Lots of beers on tap. A pool table. Sports-centric. It has everything. The bar has a design where booths and tables are situated all around the entire place. So, you can have privacy or communal seating if feel like it. It's also nice that the servers come around and check on you.

The back patio is a true patio, which doubles as a beer garden really. Again, there are sections for privacy and the patio is tiered so you get extra isolation if you want. The outdoor area does close earlier though.
author: Peter L.

description: Vally Tavern is a great place in Noe Valley. While other bars inundate you with attitude and sell you cocktails infused with stuff you never heard of before, Valley gives you hard drinks and plenty of good beer with fast service.
author: Rafael M.

description:
My group of four had brunch nearby. Wanting to continue the drinking while sitting outside (it was a nice day), one of the boys suggested Valley Tavern. We stopped by on Saturday, June 17th around 2:30pm. We all ordered at the bar and brought our drinks to the outdoor patio.

*Tavern Pimm's Cup: Pimm's No 1, gin, lemon, lime, cucumber, ginger beer ($12)
*Racer 5 IPA: Bear Republic, Healdsburg CA, 7.5% ABV, 75 IBU ($6.50)
*Space Dust: Elysian, Seattle WA, 8.2 ABV, 73 IBU ($7.50)
*Allagash White: Allagash, Portland ME, 5.1% ABV, 28 IBU ($8)

I got the allagash white. I couldn't really drink anymore, so I wanted something that was easy to sip on. We sat outside for a good two hours just enjoying the sun and talking. It was a slow afternoon, so we just chilled and caught up. I hadn't seen my some of my friends in a while. The waitress was really nice and attentive. She kept checking up on us even though we were just nursing our one drink each. The patio is actually rather big with many levels. We didn't have trouble finding a table as there was only one other party out there. Ended up sitting at the picnic table on the top level to the left when you enter the patio.

Great bar if you want to sit outside and enjoy a drink. Or a few if you're in the mood. If in the area, I'll definitely be back.
author: Elena N.

description:
I really like this spot because the patio area is big and its pretty nice to hang out in mid-day. They have a decent selection of beer and liquor and its clean.
Perfect spot for a lazy day.
author: Tom S.

description:
I've been to Valley Tavern twice now and the atmosphere is nice. However, on my most recent visit, I was charged more for my drink than the price listed on the menu. I tried to fix the issue and brought the error to the staff's attention, but the bartender said that the menu was incorrect and that the correct price was the more expensive version listed on my bill. 

I left Valley Tavern feeling off about this, since to me, the ethical thing to do would have been to honor the price listed on the menu.
author: Taylor W.

description: So many beers! So many screens! Finally, a real sports bar!! So happy. Even an outdoor area. Easy parking outside. I might be in love.
author: Kari E.

description: Fun local bar. Many screens. Bartender was friendly and knowledgeable. He also allowed us to bring our pizza to eat!
author: A. R.

description: We visited the tavern on a saturday evening. It was not crowded. and, ordered different types of beers. When you drinking your beer, you can talk with yiur friends, volume of the music is quite good. The main problem is here, they only serve 2 types of panini to eat. There is no any food such as chips, frebch fries. You can get some food from the other restaurants and bring them inside to Valley to eat they allow it. Guys who work there are cool and helpful.
author: Hatice S.

description:
I am not a Barfly like Charles Bukowski as I have only drank three times in my life & all before the age of 21. I am a big hoops fan & especially since the Warriors have been having a historical season which makes hoops in the Bay Area exciting. I haven't owned a television in 20 years nearly as long as I have been vegan so going to see the Warriors play in the Finals at a Sports bar is a definite for me.

I met some friends at Valley Tavern to watch the Warriors & the Cavs game. My friends enjoyed their beer while I had a grapefruit juice. The service here was on point. The energy was nice & the bar had several large screens for viewing the game. 

Another nice addition was that Valley Tavern allows you to enjoy food from outside. One of the friends I was with had some pizza from Patxi's Pizza next door & found out that Patxi's pizza has Daiya Vegan Cheese which is awesome for those who want vegan pizza. 

The game was exciting as was neck & neck the whole time yet the Warriors broke through in the final minutes led by Durant's superb performance in the clutch. He will be the Finals MVP!

The only drawback here was we were sitting right next to a smoking room & every time the door opened it was heavy w/ the smell of cigarette smoke. Definitely a time warp into back in the day before there was smoking & non-smoking sections of restaurants yet for those who smoke that could be a good thing. 

Go Warriors! I recommend coming here for game 4 of the Finals on Friday where the undefeated Warriors could potentially have a historical game becoming the first team in pro sports history to remain perfect in the post-season.

Warriors! Warriors! Straight out of Oakland.
author: Shane S.

description: Bloody Mary Review - Handmade with sriracha, tabasco, horseradish, black pepper and celery salt, this true tavern style bloody mary is easy to sip, and perfectly spiced. A full bodied heat coats your mouth while a bright acidity washes it all down. Garnished with bar olives, a cocktail onion, pepperoncini, celery, lemon and lime, you'll have all the nibbles you need. Why go? Spice. | Price: $8.50
author: Shelley B.

description:
This place is tight! I can see how it's a a popular watering hole for the neighborhood. Kinda divey - woodsy interior, lots of seating.Friendly bartenders, EXTENSIVE list of cool local beers/ciders on tap, and also many imaginative cocktails! I ordered something that had Peet's cold brew and Bailey's. Thumbs up.

Cool outside patio in the back, not much to see, but good option to be outside. Smoking allowed outside though, so not too great for non-smokers like myself.

Swing by if you're in the area!
author: Emily C.

description: Watched NBA Finals here and had a blast. Not a bad seat in the place. Great selection and friendly staff. Loved it.
author: Erin H.

description:
This place has a friendly staff and large selection. Plenty of sports and other friendly patrons. 

Live in the area now after being in the east bay for 2.5 years and returned to noe valley because of places like this.
author: David A.

description: It's almost 15 years later from my first visit and it hasn't changed, a drinkers bar with good drinks and TVs for sport... quick service and great location... what does one expect! Not worth a trip for a tourist but as a local bar it's stellar... would be nice to live closer... but oh well...
author: Reg B.

description:
This is such a great neighborhood bar! My friend and I were exploring the area and felt it was time for a drink or two. Valley Tavern popped up on Yelp and was also the closest one. We walked in around 4:30-5 and the place was pretty empty (but by the time we left, they had a full house and a live band setting up!). The bar is super spacious, with bar seating, booths and regular tables up in the back. And what sports bar would be a sports bar without walls of TVs?

The bartender was interesting -- she was super nice, but at the same time a bit standoff ish? I'm not sure...She asked for our IDs, then walked away to help another customer. Then she'd ask us what drinks we'd want, then go close out someone's tab haha It was in no way rude, but it was weird?

Anyway, I had my first Bloody Mary here. Yes, you read right. I had it with Grey Goose, medium spicy. SO GOOD! My friend got hers spicy, and loved it as well. After our cocktails, we both got a pint of beer. The bartender actually gives you samples to try! I don't see this happen too often at bars (or maybe I'm going to the wrong ones...). But that was super nice! The strawberry wheat one, not 21st Amendment, was really good. Those who don't like sweet may not like it though haha

They have a menu of all their cocktails and beers on the tables and bar counter, which is great. Prices are pretty reasonable, too. Hope to stop by again soon!
author: Doris K.

description: It's a bar, I guess? It's pretty inexpensive. I had cocktails with a friend here at some point; I recall them having a very strong taste of liquor. They didn't seem all that well-mixed.
author: John L.

description: Love this place! Good vibes, exellent service, and delicious drinks! Keep coming there every week. My favorite spot in Noe Valley
author: Guy H.

description:
Great little bar that's perfect for watching the game or just hanging with friends. Really awesome service (quick and friendly!) with your standard booze selection. I also appreciate that they've got a few food items on the menu- it's no frills stuff like fries, wings, burgers- but by not having a massive menu they can turn around the food quickly and it all tasted above average for a bar. They also let you bring in outside food which is a massive plus!

Really big and nice outdoor patio (with plenty of TVs for watching the game) as well. Only one bathroom though which is a major bummer-

Check it out for sure!
author: Elliott W.

description: This is our neighborhood spot! Everyone is welcome, we say it's the "realest place in Noe Valley." Brittany is awesome, they couldn't pull up the Oregon game we wanted to see and she pulled it up on her laptop and she streamed it for us. That's the type of place this is. Our hood, our peeps. Real San Francisco and Noe Valley. Not enough stars  available to rate our gem!
author: Timothy F.

description:
Friendly staff, great large patio area, and they know how to make a bloody mary!  They don't serve food, but sometimes they set up a grill outside and have a limited menu for game days. 
 Only complaint is that the patio isn't dog friendly!
author: Riley D.

description: Deklin was nice enough to grab my friends wallet before we caught our lyft home. Great service, cheap beer and solid cocktails. 5 stars without hesitation!
author: Taylor T.

description: Not a bad spot. Plenty of taps and not expensive. There's plenty of seating. They're happy to change the TVs to whatever you're looking for.
author: Micah B.

description: The beer is good, not great, 20+ taps, nothing of mention. If you want good service, you better be friends with the bartender, because she's too busy on her phone or conversing with her clique. We saw this spot as a potential local sports bar, we're gonna stick to Paxti's if we're in the neighborhood.
author: jacob m.

description:
If you go here, hope that you get the lovely Linda as your bartender. She pours the best drinks, is understanding when you spill and is as nice as gets. If you were to try irish car bombs, you probably wont break our record. 

Ps bring back the fryer
author: Anthony G.

description: Best Bloody Mary I've had in the Bay Area. Hands-down. The bartender was friendly and knew exactly what she was doing -- no garbage mix, just straight and simple with a generous serving of Tabasco (she asked whether I wanted it spicy). The garnish was amazing, too. Knocked a star because they weren't letting people out onto the terrace.
author: Nic Z.

description: In all honesty, this place is a dive bar with lots of tvs, but not to take anything away from its name, Valley Tavern feels like an old-timey tavern when you walk in. Wooden planks, secluded booths, and random bags of chips and nuts surround you as you take a seat at the bar. TVs blare overhead in every direction as the bartender makes her way over to ask what you'd like. Giant Bloody Mary for $10? Or special Valley Tavern mule (in the right cup) for $6? Or, how about one of our tens of draft beers, many bottles of wine, or solid selection of spirits? I could grow to love this place, especially because the space is huge and parking is easy. If they had food all the time, this would be my watering hole. Oh, and $2 off your first drink for checking in on Yelp. Good times to be had by all. You'll thank me later.
author: Danny C.

description:
As my friend is addicted to Easy Breezy (ok, it is really good), we had walked past Valley Tavern countless times and I'd commented on wanting to try it out. So on our bar hopping day drinking event on a hot San Francisco Saturday, Valley Tavern was my first stop.

The place is huge. Long bar, with a number of booths across from it and past it. There are two up front areas - one of which is a designated smoking section with it's own door that I thought was an interesting touch. The beer selection is actually pretty good. Not a pure craft beer bar, but they did have Almanac on tap and a number of other local craft breweries which I appreciated. The staff was also very attentive and helpful. There are pool tables somewhere, and they grab food from neighboring spots.

Now for the true highlight of the bar - the backdoor patio/beer garden. Ok, first you hit this back foyer type area, which is the perfect spot if you're by yourself and want to read or get some work done and enjoy your beverage with natural light but not outside. Then you reach the three tiered back patio: 
The bottom level has a table but is really there if you can't get higher seats. 
The second level has 4 long wood booths. Depending on the way the sun is hitting or popularity, you might be sharing one of these.
The third level has one dedicated booth (which makes it feel a bit like a private VIP section) and another which was closed off that they may turn into a quick bar on popular days. 

The outdoor area does close early due to noise, but the amazing Irish bartender was serving us out there.

If I'm in Noe Valley and want a great weekend day bar, Valley Tavern is it.
author: Michael C.

description: I don't frequent Noe Valley much but when my wife and I were in the area, we passed this cute place with a sign "beer garden" out in front and we couldn't say no to that. Luckily it was a nice sunny day and sitting outside with a few drinks and with our friends was a perfect Sunday indeed.
author: Vanessa O.

description: Food, TVs at every angle and then some, too many types of beer to go through, and game 5 Warriors v. Cleveland. Heaven.
author: Gordon B.

description: Linda is the greatest! Best bar I've ever been to. Try to break the car bomb record, you can't. #bringbackthefryer
author: Jeff P.

description: My best friend and I came here the day after saint patricks day and enjoyed several drinks before walking back to our Airbnb. Adorable little place. Service was great and fast. Nice people! Wish I was there now!
author: Brittney F.

description:
This is everything I want a bar to be. Friendly staff,  friendly crowd,  vast beer selection,  great food,  comfortable patio.  The place is always the right  amount of populated for people like me and my friends who enjoy a relaxed and non crowded environment.  

New favorite bar in the city.
author: Kyle S.

description: Great place to grab some drinks and watch a big game. They have plenty of TV's to go around, also a great selection of beer. Definitely coming back for some games!
author: Ian E.

description: Cool sports bar in the Noe Valley area, with a lot of tv's and ample bar space. The outdoor patio is also cool, and I liked the taps that stick out of the wall (no beer dispensed, btw). But $6 for a Trumer cup of beer, not even a pint or a bottle? Damn, Daniel. That seems to be their market rate, even though I went during St. Patrick's Day. I understand if it was a draft, but a cup? I don't think that's me being cheap, either (I've paid $10 for German craft beers, so I'm not afraid to spend, as long as it's for a worthy product). At least the service, even though it was busy, was fast and efficient. BART is also about a 15 minute walk away for commuters going back to the Big Bad East Bay. They also let you bring food in (there's apparantly a Patxi's pizza right next door).
author: Dan M.

description: The Best bar in Noe Valley .. very professional service, very good environment for those who want to have a rest from the problems
author: Marcos R.

description: The food is great. Soup, sandwiches and salads superb. A bit pricey.
author: Chris B.

description:
Good beer, good sports, I come alive in the day time! ;) Valley Tavern is the perfect place to grab a beer and watch the game with your friends. Like Stuft Pizza in Milpitas, their walls are lined with TVs. 

Besides the full bar, they have booths and tables scattered throughout this sports bar. If you're not sitting at the bar, the servers will come around quite frequently to clear your table and check if you need anything. What's even better than the great atmosphere is the *secret garden* in the back. All the way in the back, they have a table set up with salads, breads, hot dogs, cheeseburgers, and even pastries. It's free for the taking, but please leave a tip for the cook!

... Go Niners!
author: Christine S.

description:
I'm not a bar person, and I loved this place. We came here for the super bowl. Free food, great beer and a garden!!! This is why I'm giving this place a 5 star. Because I was able to stay in a bar for 4 hours without going crazy. Inside was other story. Too crowded and two noisy (again, I'm not a bar person).

I'm pretty sure I'll be there for the next super bowl!
author: Maggie J.

description: I have been here a couple times now and as someone who loves beer and great service, this is the place to go. The atmosphere has character which is refreshing compared to other bars in the city. It has a really cool outdoor space that is terraced with lots of tables. The selection of beers on draft is one of the best you will find. Finally, one of the times I went was during a Warriors Playoff Game and the place was packed. I have worked in hospitality before and the way the staff handled the crowd was perfect. They worked their butts off to make sure everybody was getting service in a timely manor. I was extremely impressed and will be going back to this gem for years to come. Oh yeah, they also serve food.
author: David H.

description:
Love this place. 
Local yokels from my neighborhood.   Laid back.  Mellow.  Friendliest bar staff I have ever met. 
BBQ during football games. Very mixed crowd. 
I love the selection of beers on tap!
There is a great jukebox and Paxtis Pizza (next door) will deliver right to your place at the bar. One of the bartenders will even order for you. This is a great place. Truly a SF original.
author: Thomas D.

description:
My favorite bar in Noe Valley. Large selection of beers on tap, lots of tv, cool neighborhood people, great service. The place is clean and looks good.
They have a patio which is great on warm days if you want to come as a group of friends or even on your own.
author: Muhip T.

description: Great place! Old American style pub quite cheap and with a good food and beer selection. I would definitely stop there again cause I d like to try a lot of stuff that was on the menu but didn't have enough room. Service was not so good.
author: Aaron L.

description: Wow this place is great. Strong drinks, excellent service, and a beautiful back patio. LOVE.
author: Melissa M.

description:
The best Sports Bar in San Francisco is the (Noe) Valley Tavern. 

Televisions galore adorn every higher wall in this establishment. TVs in HD and nice and big easily create an environment with no bad seat in the house. 

Great beer list on draft as well and prices are fair at $6 a craft pint. 

They even serve grilled sausages of different variety for FREE on game day. 

Say what you want about Noe, the Valley Tavern is the soul of this part of town.
author: Andrew T.

description: Nice local tavern...a large selection of beers on tap!  Wonderful garden terraces to gather with friends and socialize.  An ample sized bar surrounded with a large number of big screens displaying a variety of sporting events.  Booths inside to cozy with a date or group of buds.  Tasty drinks...friendly on it bartenders an Waitstaff!
author: Nancy M.

description: Love love love the valley tavern! Come with some friends and enjoy the back patio in the sun with some beer or mixed drinks! Favorite spot in Noe Valley for casual drinks and conversation.
author: William B.

description: This place attempts to be a little divey but is actually really nice. You can go here for birthday or other celebrations, great couch/cubicle type seating and affordable drinks! Lots of screens if you want to watch a game too. Nicer than most of the places I've been to in the mission.
author: Nilay P.

description:
Walked in while waiting for a table to open up at Contigo. 
Not bad, pretty chill. Has a pool table in the back.
author: Kristina B.

description: Have been coming to this bar as a favorite for a few years now.  They made a mean bloody mary and have so many good beers on tap!  The staff are great and its probably one of the best places to catch a game.  Pro Tip:  You can order a pizza from Patxis next door and bring it in - they don't mind. :)
author: Jessica J.

description:
Came here to watch the World Cup final. Super crowded. Was at a table with 9 people, ordering all kinda of drinks. We probably spent well over $250. The waitress was really busy and My girlfriend and I wanted water, so I walked to Starbucks and bought two bottles of water. When I tried to come back in, the owner stopped me and said I can't bring bottled water inside. He said they sell water and I couldn't bring outside water in. As he is saying this, people are entering with pizza, coffee, etc...all from outside sources. So I walk to my car and put the bottles inside. When I come back, the owner says sorry and asks what number table I'm at and will bring water to me. I tell him and say that we're spending lots of money and just want water. He says he'll bring it. 

It's now been 25 minutes and he hasn't brought water. I've asked the waitress and she hasn't brought water. 

Not sure what's going on here, but they're only interested in you if you're spending money. God forbid you should ask for anything free. I'm surprised I even got a free napkin. 

Dear owner - you're a jerk and I won't come back here again.  

PS it's now been 30 minutes and no water.

PPS it's now been 40 minutes without water. 

PPPS it's now been 50 minutes since I asked for water...and nothing.

PPPPS finally got water 55 minutes after asking. Not even thirsty anymore.
author: Michael B.

description:
Live just up the street and this is absolutely hands-down the best bar in the neighborhood.

Something for everybody really.  Little enclosed - but open to the street - smoking room at the front, small patio at rear , and a long bi-level main bar with a dozen or so screens showing a variety of the sports du jour.

Huge ale selection and prices are decent.  Plastic happily accepted.  Bring in your own food, or order in from the neighboring pizza and pasta places.
Friendly crowd of, mainly, locals.  Lots of euro expats, especially during the soccer games.  Wide age range.

Staff are uniformly great, friendly and efficient folks.  That's what keeps me coming back.  Special shout out to Declan, Rikki and Linda.
author: David P.

description:
Right down the st from my house, local pubs are always the best.

Enough TV's everywhere so you can catch the games and a huge beer list.

Did i mention that they will grab food from across the st? perfect idea.
author: Enrique R.

description: My husband and I were in town and staying in the neighborhood.  We stopped in on a Thursday afternoon for a couple of drinks after touring Alcatraz. The place was pretty empty except for a few regulars at the bar. The bartender was friendly and greeted us as we grabbed a seat. Nice selection of draft beers and all were reasonably priced. Would definitely stop in again next time we are in the area.
author: Amy H.

description:
I bring anyone that teases me for moving to Noe Valley here - and it does a pretty good job of soliciting an 'alright, I guess it's not too bad'.  They have a solid beer selection and nice little patio and plenty of screens playing the game.

That being said, do not try their 'specialty' drinks.  Their tika masala bloody mary was hands down the nastiest thing I have ever drank and their pickle back is pretty gnarly as well.
author: Krystle S.

description:
Excellent neighborhood bar:
Friendly staff
Adequate (but not particularly novel or wide) selection of beers on tap
Good group of regulars
Bar + tables + patio seating before 8pm
Several screens for ball games
What's not to like?
author: Scott C.

description: Pretty good for watching football.  Lots of TVs with many games on.  They don't serve food in house though.  If you order food, they get it from a restaurant nearby in a takeout container.  The beer selection was very good and the cocktails were decent.  Cool neighborhood...
author: Nisha P.

description: Go to spot for NFL Sundays.  Good crowd, good beer, and free food, what more can you ask for.  During playoff time, this place is packed for the niner games.  They will have free BBQ (burgers, hot dogs, wings, ribs), did I mention they're free.  TV's are all around the place.  There must be over 15 TV's.
author: Justin Y.

description: Disappointed with service mostly and, as a unique beer lover, I was disappointed with their selection. I'll continue to walk to my favorite beer bar, Toronado's and Patix's in Noe Valley, though limited beer selection. They are more personable and not clique-ish like Valley Tavern.
author: Don M.

description:
I love this place! TONS of beers (and ciders yay) on tap, super friendly staff, and really thorough sports coverage. I was here for the Giants winning the 2012 WS, and it was SUPER!! They've always been really accommodating of large parties (their new upper-level booths are fantastic), and they're reasonably priced, too. 

Also, I have to disagree with some of the other commenters--I've never experienced any sort of discrimination from either staff or patrons. It's a nice vibe here; friendly, gregarious, basically as advertised--a good neighborhood bar.
author: Rachel B.

description:
Just moved to the area so came here looking for a place to grab a drink and watch the games.  Overall was very pleased with the experience the staff was friendly and the drinks were good (bloodymarys).

Would definitely come back here again and seems like it would be a great place to hang out and enjoy some sports games.
author: Matt H.

description:
Oh yeah!  Screens on practically every wall to watch sports, an awesome selection of beers and well drinks, and a great place to hang out with the buddies.  

The only reason why it gets 4 stars is because they don't have any grub- however they do have menus from neighboring eats (e.g. patxi's who delivers within steps of this place.)  Well, by forgoing the food, there will be less drinks to make me experience paresthesias of my phalanges.

Be prepared to be faked out about how young you look by the bouncer at night, because ID's are required by all.  I don't look like a spring chicken anymore, so I am not easily flattered when asked to produce my drivers license.
author: John L.

description:
Was recently sharing reminiscences of living in Noe Valley with a chick I met at a party and she said, "Yeah, Noe is great there just arn't a lot of bars to go to at night except um...you know...that one..."

"Valley Tavern?" I posited. 

"Yeah, yeah. That's the one! Where you can smoke in that weird little area! How'd you know?" she exclaimed.

"That's where all the bad Noe kids hang out."

We giggled. But it's true. And by bad kids of course I mean cool kids that still don't have kids. 

Seriously though, Valley Tavern is a refreshing "Just a regular ole dive bar" in the midst of so much Whole Foods, acupuncture  Double Soy Latte, fro-yo, children's learning toys pretension. It's kind of fun to watch the shock and awe as the Noe-folk walk past the smokers box ("People STILL SMOKE???"). Yeah, they do. Get outside of the Bay Area once and awhile, for god's sake.

In general, a great place to get the stick removed from your ass if your starting to develop one (and we all do these days, right???). Lots of good beers on tap. Pool table. Internet jukebox regularly loaded with the eclectic stuff by Noe denizens with good taste. Nice bartenders, fun bouncer, good for sports, and even karaoke a couple nights a week.
author: Serena Q.

description:
The Valley Tavern used to be my spot for watching games and meeting friends when I lived in Noe. It has the pub feel with many beers on tap, pool table in the back and always entertaining. 

There's karaoke for those who dare to sing a little louder and they let you bring in outside food, so I suggest you order a Paxti's pizza from next door and order a few pints in the meantime. Next song up is yours...
author: Rebekah T.

description:
Went to VT for the Monday Night Football game. It was about as lively as I expected Noe Valley to be..... This seems to be a quiet bar to grab a drink and catch up with friends while viewing a game on 1 of their 15 tvs. The crowd seemed to be more 40-50s and grabbing a beer after work.... It is not loud and easy to talk with one another at the large booths or at the bar. 
There are large number of foreign beers on tap and a really cool beer garden in the back. Also, the pizza place next door delivers into the bar or you are allowed to bring food since they do not serve any. They do however supply plates, utensils, etc.  Very friendly service! 

Worth a visit for some good european beer!
author: Paul P.

description: Neighborhood bar which now serves food. Really just comes across as a mediocre brewpub with poor service. Which works for Noe. Won't be returning, will go to Dubliner instead.
author: F G.

description: Great spot with loads of quality taps. Lots of screens to watch games and friendly staff. Nice beer garden for good weather. A bit pricey - $7 for a beer. Great neighborhood.
author: Lori P.

description:
Oh you dear dear dear old friend!  How I enjoy drinking with you on Friday nights!.... Thank you so much for letting me bring dinner in......

This place is great!  The staff is Irish or Irish adjacent... I love to ask 'what county are you from' (if you're Irish you will understand)... The hubby says it's important for an Irishman to have 'his bar' where everyone knows your name...and you can talk about the going ons back home....   The crowd is very engaging and liberal... everyone is there to unwind a bit...
author: Blake J.

description: This joint has an awesome back patio. Its three levels which allows you to find at least one spot. On a hot sunny day its as if you are somewhere else. The brews and bloodys are delicious and the bathrooms are surprisingly clean. Good stop if you want to read and grab a beverage.
author: Bri R.

description: The only bar in the area that's not a complete dive. which is a nice option.  Plenty of TVs and an extensive liquor list.  We sat at a table and had to wait like ~20 minutes to get a waitress to come over (mind you it was NOT very busy, at all).  And then she had to take our orders once, go back to the bar and get a notebook because she for them, and then take them again.  Add 10 more minutes to get drinks, and we were losing steam fast.  All in all took way way way too long to get simple drinks when we could have just walked up to the bar and ordered in 5 minutes.  Our mistake, but not super impressed.
author: Raina D.

description:
Very nice bar, with a HUGE selection of beers.
I went there to watch a football game and I really enjoyed it! 
The only thing is that they don't serve food, but it's ok to bring your own. Other reviewers recommended the pizza place next door, but it's quite expensive.
author: Charles R.

description: The live music performances are realllyy good! No cover charge  and great cheeseburgers.
author: rena b.

description: Huge and regularly updated selection of beers on tap - including good stouts, Matilda, and sometimes also Fort Point. Decent TV screens for various sports, a sizeable beer garden, and Free BBQ on football Sundays too!
author: Nik Y.

description:
Came here for a 49ers game a few months back and it is definitely a great place to grab a beer, sit back and chill.

Large selection of beers on tap, and there's even a yelp checkin coupon! $2 off on your first visit! 

There's quite a few tv's in the bar so you won't get blocked, especially in the back. I can't vouch for the people in the booths as more and more people trickled in and stood in front of the tvs though. 

What makes this place even better?! They have free food! (With tips much appreciated, of course)  It's self served out in the back patio. Someone is cooking food somewhere and constantly bringing food out,. There's hot dogs, and salads, with the occasional chicken wings and even bbq! 

Definitely a place to keep bookmarked. I'll see you again soon, Valley Tavern! Especially when football season comes back.
author: Harriet W.

description:
this is our go to spot for a beer and some football.

they have multiple tv screens indoors and outdoors.  beware though...this place gets super packed on sundays (during football season).   they offer free bbq on sundays...just don't forget to leave a tip.  valley tavern also has a wide variety of draught beers...wish they had trumer pils...but i guess i don't mind the pilsner urquell.  

the bartenders are super nice and attentive...oh, and they have a pool table!  

bathrooms have been pretty clean when i've used them...but then again, i try to avoid them on sundays.  haha.  they don't offer food...but i normally like to grab a slice at patxi's next door.  pizza and beer...can't go wrong with that combo right?
author: Jen W.

description:
FINALLY GETTING AROUND TO THE REVIEW! THUMBS UP GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE TAVERN SQUAD!! Decklin, Olivia, Britt!

This is our regular stomping ground during the NFL season. Although the staff are 49-er fans they are uber New England Patriot friendly as well whooo hoooo! Usually there is a huge following of New England fans in this bar. I've also watch Sharks games and MLB here. It's a total different crown on evenings and weekends though. 

Tons of draft beer selection available by pitcher also, a wicked homemade bloody mary, and you can have food delivered from nearby restaurants if you want.

****TO THE CHEAPSKATE "ARTHUR Z" WHO REVIEWED ABOUT THEIR COVER CHARGE THIS YEAR:
During playoffs this year they charged a $5 cover to weed out the bad element that started coming into the bar, and it worked out great! No problems with drunks/riff raff trying to cause trouble! The locals and regulars had no problem paying a measly $5 to get in, and yes they always put out a ton of bbq food all season and never charge (donation only if wanted). Obviously if you had a problem with the cover charge, you aren't a local/regular, don't know the bar, and I for one am glad your cheap ass won't be back! 

Funny how Arthur Z has to leave San Ramon to find a decent bar huh, nuff ced.
author: Risque B.

description:
The crowd has already spoken, and while I would quibble with the 4-star average, people have successfully hit upon all the main points. To recap:

Staff: awesome
TV's: showing the game
Porch: Open again (NIMBY's can't keep us down!) and sunny (Noe Valley)
Bloody Mary's: try them with Hanger 1 Chipotle Vodka next time
Food: The bar is now serving Paxti's, Little Chihuaha, and Easy Breezy, for those willing to walk less than a block.

In short, a winner.
author: David C.

description:
Midnight in the Garden of Good and Evil,

This place is a great tavern for anyone looking to go have a nice drink. It caters to the sports fans with TV's that play games. It caters to intelligent types with their Brainstormer's quiz. It caters to Sun worshippers with it's beautiful backyard garden.

Pros:

1. Friendly staff and very prompt
2. Lots of seating both inside and out
3. The only tavern in the area with a great garden
4. The most beers on tap of any of the bars in the area
5. Brainstormer Quiz on Tuesdays

Cons:
1. Smoking room in the front of the building. As a former smoker, I realize this is a pro for you. I however can't stand the smell of smoke anymore. (the good news is, the smoke smell doesn't carry into the rest of the bar.
author: Robert B.

description:
This is a solid watering hole. Been here a handful of times over the past couple years.

-open space inside, natural light, not some seedy joint, and there's a tri-level beer garden with outdoor flat screens

-Patxi's delivers! & their menus are everywhere.
Additionally, you can bring your own food in.  Once a friend of mine and I brought some killer sandwiches from the deli across the street, the bartender immediately gave us plates and extra napkins. He rocks. Plus, he was bumpin 80s when we went.

-Kick ass tap beer selection

- Unpretentious crowd, both blue collar and suiters out of their suits

-Not a dive and definitely NOT a loser bar.  You've been to those and if you're like me, they end up on the ixnay list.
author: Athena S.

description:
As just about the only place open past 10pm on 24th Street in Noe Valley, I'm a fan of Valley Tavern when I'm in the neighborhood, even though I don't have a lot of options unless I want to make that long walk to the Mission or the Castro. 

The crowd is mostly local, since Noe Valley doesn't exactly call the party set. They've got a big selection of beers on tap, though I wish there was more variety in the wheat beer department, mostly because I drink like a college sophomore rushing a sorority. That said, the cocktails are strong and the Fireball shots we had made me curiously drunk-ish even after I woke up the next morning. 

Of course, post-midnight, your options get very limited for transportation if you don't live in the area or have a designated driver. ('Cause drinking and driving is for jerkfaces.) But thankfully, the cabs in the area seem to know that too, and we were able to catch one rather quickly. 

If you find yourself in Noe Valley past 10pm, well, as far as I know, this is your only option. But the wait staff is friendly and the drinks strong, so as "only options" go, this is a pretty good one.
author: Kevin B.

description:
Cool place to hangout only when you're with your friends. I came here on the way to home to get a beer and hopefully to meet some people but that wasn't the case. The lady bartenders were busy talking with each other and the crowd was only sticking to themselves (rightly so as one does at a bar). Didn't feel welcomed here but would come back only with a group with my friends.

 As for friendlier bar, I'll go to The Peaks down the street.
author: Ezequiel R.

description: Nice local spot to catch the game and a cold one. Nice crowd.    - 1star as the took out the pool table.
author: Mick H.

description: Visited on a Sunday morning to watch the 49ers play. Was absolutely packed, but has a nice atmosphere with plenty of die-hard fans. Free food on the back patio throughout the game. I'd definitely return if I'm ever in the neighborhood during a game.
author: Andy M.

description:
Valley Tavern, you've earned a coveted 5 star review! 

This place is awesome! The bar is cozy, but not too small. There is an outside patio, pool table, bar. 

More importantly: every Sunday, they have FREE food! Yes, free hot dogs and hamburgers, as well as assorted chips, etc. It's an amazing perk to the usual bar fare and i was very impressed. 

Top all of this off with a badass digital jukebox and we've got ourselves a go-to location! 

If you're not planning on heading to Noe Valley, well, here's a reason why you should!
author: Tom A.

description: I have been coming to the Valley Tavern for the past 4 Patriots seasons. In my opinion, it's the best sports bar in San Francisco. Lots of big screen TVs and plenty of seating so you can always see the game. I can't say enough about Decklin, Britt, and everyone who works there. They are always friendly and the service is always great. I would highly recommend Valley Tavern to anyone looking for a great sports bar in the city.
author: Dan M.

description: Very cool neighborhood pub. Beer selection is great & staff is friendly. TV's everywhere which is awesome since the Giants are in The World Series! Cheers!!
author: Ellie A.

description: So I am finally back  to my  home sweet home San Francisco Noe Valley   from the Army most of the time I was stationed  in Germany  I think this place use to be called rat and raven forgot . but I went in there to have a beer and seen it looked different for the better. and a lot more beer but only 1 or  2  from Germany  and of course the ones I did not care for but in the end it worked out I got to try ones I never heard of and they were pretty good so I will be trying a different one  each week. the people there were all cool and laid back, no sketchy people hanging in the latrines or outside and being out I felt pretty safe in there. now the trick is meeting new friends.
author: Gabriel R.

description: Wednesday 25cent wings! The chili lime is my favorite but buffalo isn't bad either. You have GOT to try their garlic crab fries though, it is one of the best things I've ever tasted and the portions are huge! The atmosphere is great for watching sports games but get there early, because it will be crowded!
author: Yige Z.

description:
If in San Francisco's Noe Valley neighborhood, and thirsty, go nowhere else but the VT (as we locals call it). The drinks are great, especially if you're lucky to get one of the barkeeps to make you a mixed cocktail. The crowd is very friendly, and they have an outside beer garden in the back that's open until 8pm for taking in the sun on those beautiful SF days. 

With a whole bunch of TV's, you can catch any flavor of sports, may it be the Giants or the 49ers. (Yes, other teams can also be seen on the screens)

If you're looking for customer service, you'll get the best service in SF. They are ALL polite, courteous, and very prompt. No grumpiness or attitudes to be found at the VT.

Probably the best watering hole in the city. Find yourself there.
author: Sean S.

description:
Was waiting for a table at a restaurant down the street.  We stumbled into this place and had a really great time.  The drinks were good, staff was friendly and there was a Yelp check-in deal that was really nice too!

They have tons of TV's, we are going to be back for sports games and a chill night really soon!
author: Chad J.

description:
One lovely Wednesday evening I decide to satisfy my craving for a bloody Mary.. I believe Adaya ((sp?)) made my drink. Jessica brought our drinks over and was very welcoming!


I found the perfect bloody Mary!

This bloody Mary was just the right amount of spicy. It came with olives, pickled onions, celery AND pickled string beans. Neek was thrilled about this!! I'm tired of v8 poured in w a shot of vodka.. This was made with effort :) Friendly staff, dim lighting at night, fairly clean..
author: Neek W.

description:
Imagine if you will, a lovely Sunday afternoon in lovely wood-filled tavern with plenty of beer an a smattering of lovely folks (some even lingering in the lovely back patio). And towards the back, a lovely table set up with all sorts of bbq fare and a lovely little sign beckoning readers to please help themselves to the free food. 

If I wasn't holding out for a proper meal with my darling later, I would have been all over that stuff. I'm fairly certain the free food is related to NFL Sundays but that might be reason enough to get me to watch that severely docile sport in public.  

It's a lovely watering hole as it is but its participation in Barspace might be the only reason I'm not madly in love with it. It's possible to be here and not be on camera (you're not viewable if you sit towards the back) but the fact that it's there still kind of bothers me. Nevertheless, it's still a nice spot with nice people and a nice free food spread.
author: Loli L.

description: This is my favorite bar in noe valley. They have an outdoor patio in the back. This place always has a bunch of people and something going on. Cheap drinks and a good spot for drinks.
author: Rob L.

description:
Valley Tavern WAS my sports bar of choice - spent two seasons watching New Orleans Saitnts games there, as they are not televised locally, and I do not own a TV anyway,
Today I went there, got my table, watched game, ate food,...the game went into OT, as the Niners game went on. Mind you, there are about 20 tvs (estimating) all on the Niners game. Some little young lady whined that THEY SAID ALL THE TVS WOULD BE ON THE NINERS - waittess grabbed remote and changed channel telling me I COULD FIND SOMEWHERE ELSE TO WATCH THE END OF THE GAME..which, by the way, ended a quick field goal later.
So, anyway, since it does not matter that customers other than 49er fans are not reprsented there, I WILL FIND ANOTHER PLACE TO WATCH THE GAME. there are plenty of places with a beer and a television 
AND A BETTER ATTITUDE..
author: Eugenia P.

description:
There is absolutely nothing wrong with the Valley Tavern. It's a tavern.  In Noe Valley.  And when I'm looking to have a quick drink after a long afternoon stroller-dodging on 24th street, this is a solid place to wet your whistle.  The beer selection is good, it's rarely all that crowded and indoor and outdoor seating in plentiful.  

On the seating, I would actually call their beer garden the highlight of the place.  I'd been to the Tavern a few times before I even noticed it was there but once you step outside, you'll be pleasantly surprised at how big and chill it is.  

Sports fan?  I think there approximately 76 TVs in this place, so you'll have your pick.  Pool shark?  Yep, they do that here, too.  Love a booth seat in a bar?  Check.  

So lots to like about this place.  To be truthful, there is nothing exceptional about it, either, but for a good old neighborhood pub, Valley Tavern gets the job done.
author: Eric S.

description:
I'm a fan because it's close, staff is friendly and the owner knows how to run a good bar. Not cheap and I wouldn't call it a 'dive'. 

Only downside for me is that the place seems to be getting more popular lately- which means it's harder to have a conversation or find a seat.
author: martin l.

description: My favourite bar in the city. Great service, awesome staff (special shoutout to Linda) and friendly atmosphere.
author: Padraig J.

description:
Don't live around here.  Visiting my dad who lives sort of close..Diamond Heights/Noe Valley area....looked on Yelp to find somewhere to go.  

At first was disappointed to realize they didn't serve food but bartender immediately advised that a few places delivered and she was willing/able to call and place an order and give CC info so I didnt have to do anything but sit there and decide what I wanted.  I think it was Bascos or something that I had food from...decent sandwich with great fries.

All female bartenders while I was there and all three were good, especially one, but I didnt get her name as she wasn't at bar when I left.... longer wavy dark hair.  Anyway...good experience and I would come back.  Thank you!
author: Meghan G.

description: Another great neighborhood bar in my opinion. Very clean, a food menu offered, and a full bar. We indulged in a couple of beers while watching some sports and totally enjoyed ourselves. It was a Sunday so not too crowded but I would imagine this place is "poppin'" on a Friday night. In addition to the indoor area, there is an outdoor patio out back. A nice addition. I can't say much else since our time was short here but the bartender was very pleasant and there's no reason we wouldn't return if we venture out to 24th street again. Oh yeah, there is a $15 minimum for credit card transactions, but there is an ATM in the bar as well as a Wells Fargo across the street and a Chase bank about a block down.
author: Kelsey K.

description:
Great beer selection. Great crowd and atmosphere for sports.

We have been watching postseason Giants baseball here, and always have fun. 

Only negative is that beers are on the pricey side ($5.50-$6.50 a pint).
author: Steve P.

description:
This is a great beer bar!
If you like a variety of beers on tap or bottles, this is your place.  Service was great.  I came here on a Sunday afternoon, but even in the daytime the place has a good vibe.  I'm coming back in the evenings!
author: Jack R.

description:
$5 cover charge for standing room ONLY to watch the Niners/Falcons game without any drink specials and they're typical FREE NFL Sunday BBQ which turns out to NOT be FREE with the cover charge.  

We also tried to make a reservation since I have an injured knee but they lied to us and said they don't take reservations ONLY to find out that people have reserved spots even at the bar and all the booths.  Screw this place & I'm the Duke of it on YELP to, great job with the horrible marketing guys!!!  

You've lost my referrals and most of my business for your unclean old tap beer.
author: Arthur Z.

description:
I'm a regular at a bar in San Francisco's "Pleasantville", and couldn't be happier about it. Ever since I started working in the neighborhood, I began falling in love with Noe; If I were to pick a bar to represent it properly, it would be the Valley Tavern.

The crowd here is obviously very close knit and typically all regular faces, patrons and employees alike. Drinks are fairly priced and there is a large variety of beers on tap (which change every so often). 

Pool table and arcade golf, but the real ace in the hole is their back patio! Multiple tiered deck for catching rays, which is used on Sunday during football season for -FREE BBQ!- yes, I said "FREE" and "BBQ" and "football". Not only that, this place typically keeps just about any variety of important sport match on their TV's no matter how obscure the sport.

A real tavern, in Noe Valley of all places!
author: Daniel K.

description:
Love this place.  The staff are all friendly.  We come here to watch games since we don't get them at home.  The only downside is that they don't have the PAC 12 Network, which always amazes me in California bars, but that seems to be commonplace in SF. Will be back regardless. Huge upside is that if our game is on, any of the staff will always go out of their way to get it on a screen for us.

They have a solid beer list with options for everyone--it's no Monk's Kettle or Abbot's Cellar, but it's not supposed to be.  It's a friendly, fun, neighborhood bar that we love.
author: Steve K.

description: Stopped in for a beer and a shot after work.  Then I asked Katie how she rated the bloody mary out of a scale of 1-10.  She said 11.  So i bit and ordered one.  Katie was awesome and made the bloody mary perfectly... Ok it was a 10.5. But still... WOW!  Good job Katie and good job Valley Tavern
author: Aron K.

description: Cool place to grab a beer and watch the game. They usually have all the games on. They also sell beer by the pitcher which is great when you're with a group. On game days this place gets pack quick so if you want a table make sure you get there early. I wish they serve food tho.
author: Ann C.

description: We first visited the Valley Tavern when we had moved over from England and went for a drink after looking around an apartment. The Irish lady was SO nice and gave us our drinks on the house to welcome us. It was the start of a beautiful friendship. The best thing about the Valley Tavern is that when you sit outside in their fab beer garden, the cheerful ladies come out just as you're putting your empty glass down and ask you what you would like for your next drink. But the options aren't red, white or rosé or one kind of beer. Oh no. You can have a Bloody Mary made to order with extra jalapeño and an olive, an Irish coffee, a WINE GLASS OF PROSECCO, a mimosa, a house special margarita or choose from the many beers they have on draught. They also play every sports game you would possibly want to see - and STILL COME OUT TO TAKE YOUR DRINKS ORDER SO YOU DON'T HAVE TO LOSE YOUR SPOT. And even on the most busy of game days, they don't get pissed off if you order a Bloody Mary with extra celery. They still bring it out to you with extra celery - within 3 minutes!!! And they don't judge you for being British and getting drunk on a Sunday afternoon in the most child populated area of San Francisco. Valley tavern, you don't know us but we know you and we  you.
author: Claire C.

description:
Noe's. The Dubliner. Bliss. Twin Peaks. 

Now all these places have their charms, Noe's is attached to Basso's, The Dubliner is REALLY CLEAN, Bliss is dark and has jazz on Sunday afternoons, and Twin Peaks has that bartender that is always laughing and some ex-cons. But the best bar in Noe Valley is hands down The Valley Tavern. 

The tavern has everything I want in a bar. Pool table? Yeah, they gots two. Juke box, yeah, one of those infinite jobbers that I love to program for hours to keep away the Gaga and Kei$ha. Beer garden out back? Not quite the Wild Side West, but still pretty cool. Food? Delivery from Basso's, Patxi's, all good. Czechvar on tap? Oh HELLS yeah. They have like 30 beers on tap or something, so you are bound to find something you like. No Booker's bourbon though : ( 

But the best thing about the Tavern is the friendly bar staff. Declan, Marie, Kellie Jo, Jon and the rest of the crew are really fun and attentive, and, if you are a local, they get to know you and your drinks and practically have a fresh pint waiting before the first (or ninth) is gone. 

The Vally Tavern is a great, local bar, and if you live in Noe Valley or the surrounds, then I would definitely stop in if you have not yet. Cool spot.
author: Bad Y.

description: Awesome game at the Valley Tavern! Linda & Deckland are amazing & I'm definitely come back again and again and again!!!!!
author: Alpa R.

description:
VT boasts a wide array of beers on tap, and the taps are all lined on the walls framed by barrel tops.  the alcohol selection isn't too shabby either.
check out their gigantic touch screen jukebox -- i've never seen anything of that size!  patio out back for those gorgeous days, or when you just want to enjoy your pint outside, as well as an indoor smoking room.  the staff are always friendly and on point.

overall great pub.  what's not to like?
author: Sheri N.

description:
Reeks of smoke! Gross!

Good service and drinks but the smell is atrocious.

For the first time in SF, my clothes came back stinky. I wish I could frequent this bar, but there is no way I can tolerate the smell.  :(
author: Shal J.

description:
"Valley Tavern: Where the Neighborhood Meets"

San Francisco certainly won't have a shortage of bars anytime soon, so with all of this choice for the average Jane and Joe, why stop at the Valley Tavern? Aside from the awesome beer garden at the back of house, VT just feels like home: a drunken and debauch home at times, but home nonetheless. Staffed by some of the friendliest bartenders in SF, this place just feels warm and inviting. Some people might disagree with me considering the front of house looks a little plain and almost draconian, but take a step inside and sit down for a while. You'd be surprised by how easily you can strike up a conversation with one of the patrons or the bartenders when he/she isn't busy. In a world full of bars populated by sleezy men or hunched drunkards, Valley Tavern is a refreshing respite: great drinks accompanied by even greater people.

Let's be honest. You can get a beer or a cocktail anywhere, but you'll rarely get such a jovial atmosphere. Do yourself a favor: come to the Valley Tavern, grab a pint, and relax. You'll thank yourself in the morning.
author: Frank Y.

description:
Let me preface this with telling you guys that I am, in fact, a bartender. No, I haven't bartended in over 6 months, but if you asked me for a French 75 I could whip one up for you. Granted I'll be scowling and probably spit in it, but that's not the point. The point is that I know how a bartender should act, and you'll find out why I'm so damn pissed. 

The bar is relatively nice--the patio is, as well, but this whole thing about the fucking bartender being Gestapo about checking everyone's ID's. I had left mine at home, but about 90% of the people in there (to include my FATHER) could attest to me being over 21, since I drink with all of them. HELLO! We're there for CUPCAKES, not DRINKING. This is the CUPCAKE CROWD, not the DYL ALCOHOLIC CROWD, hence being a lack of SF Yelpers. There were hardly any damn people in there! You were so damn ubiquitous that you would have been able to catch people buying drinks for anyone who even *could* have been under 21. 

Then the leaves started falling all over us in a sudden wind gush, and we screamed a little. It was 3pm and you're yelling at us to keep it down because there are people living nearby? Look asshole, if you're going to live next to a BAR then prepared to stay up until the drunk idiots go home or throw up on your plants. At this point, she berates me for my damn ID again. 

Me: It's at home, but I'm 21. 
Her: It doesn't matter, you guys are yelling and if the cops come and they check ID's then I'm going to get in trouble
Me: What? That's a nice crack pipe you have in your mouth.

Ok I didn't compliment her on that, but I'm PRETTY SURE that she was smoking SOMETHING, or PMSing because she was acting like a bitch.

If I'm going to go somewhere and drink, I'll skip this one, thanks. I'll have my ID the next time, but it'll be for that *other* bar. You know, the one where I feel proud to be a bartender, not ASHAMED.
author: Jaime L.

description:
The first time I came here was with my girlfriend to grab a couple of drinks and relax.  The bartender was super nice and made my girlfriend a drink based on a general idea of what she wanted for a cocktail. I had an old fashioned that was tasty and well made. 

I came another time on my own to grab a couple drinks to wind down from a long day of work. Even by myself the place felt relaxing and lively but I wish I could have played some billiards but a group took over the table the whole night. 

I would definitely recommend this place for anyone who finds themselves in Noe Valley and looking for a good meet up spot for some friends or to grab a drink or two and watch whatever sport you want on their TVs.
author: sergio a.

description:
I freaking love the VT!

I have loved the VT since I discovered their amazing bloody marys a couple of years ago.  Those bloody marys and the relaxed neighborhood atmosphere and local guests have kept me coming back, no matter how far across town I might have been.

But then I moved to Noe Valley and I just can't stay away from the VT.  The drinks are great, the bar tenders are friendly and besides the night that the GIANTS WON THE WORLD SERIES they are rarely too crowded at night.  Ok- and except on big game days when the place is swarming with testosterone and beer towers in front of all of the big TVs.

They don't serve their own food, but have no problem with you bringing in your own.  They even have menus from the local restaurants for you to have delivered right to your table or the bar!

Not that I want you to come and steal the table I was going to take, but there is a huge patio in the back. And a TV.  And free food on Sundays. Word
author: Laura P.

description: This is an AWESOME place to come watch a game. Here for world cup and the service was great.  Love Linda and Decklan. This is the place to be.
author: Jojo R.

description: Love this place!! Would recommend watching all sports games here - tons of TVs and great service.
author: Kathleen O.

description:
Sports on the screens, beer and Paxti's pizza. 

What more could you want in a bar in the middle of Baby Land?
author: Jay H.

description:
There are several things I've begun to notice since mortality has come knocking around my arrogant younger self and they are as follows:

1.  Large venue parties have given way to smaller dinner parties.
2.  My straight Asian hair has decided to go native and get wavy at times.
3.  I am a night owl, but even more so.
4.  My walks are gaining in time and distance as I wander more frequently.

But the one thing that keeps me grounded in the firm belief that you are what you think you are, is going to a local pub where the drinks are strong, the beer keeps flowing, bartenders tend to their liquor keeps, and the men are men.

recent visits here have been dates.  Yes, you heard it right.  He he.

My experience here last night was everything but, since I was not expecting to stop by a bar before a birthday soiree I had been invited to.  First off, I had nothing to eat since that afternoon.  Second, Crown Royal has got to be smoother than the Tanqueray gin that winked at me from the table.  One sip and it bit and burned my lips.  After a few seconds of discomfort, it slid effortlessly and I began to feel very warm.  The gin/tonic became an afterthought...

The bar is indicative of typical Irish pubs.  Lots of dark wood, seats are dark, and as my friend pointed out, the walls were of earthen color and the decorations tinged in red, so I had nothing to worry about.  A nice gesture of assuaging the warming factor that usually indicated to me that the flush of alcohol consumption was rising and appearing on my cheeks (basically, I look like a raccoon)  A step up and two pool tables flanked themselves under the bright lights.

There is also a small enclosure in which many could stand and smoke away to their hearts content.  Reminded me of the clear cubes set off to the side for smokers at the St. Louis terminal on my way to Wisconsin.  Specimens.  For study.

In all, I felt giddy and extremely talkative, no thanks to the vivid slap of Crown Royal earlier.  But am happy to report, that all conversations were delivered on an even keel and in an eloquent manner.  Mortality can be forgiving ;)
author: Miika M.

description:
Whoever had the idea to have a cupcake bakeoff at a bar was pretty creative because you have the vices of sugar and alcohol colliding together!

Cute bar.  Unfriendly bartenders.  Great secluded space.
author: Jen S.

description:
One of my preferred local watering holes of Noe Valley.  I have been here to start the evening and to wrap up an evening. Either way it is a good place with decent deals. While they do not server food they have a bunch of options from local food vendors. So no need to fret if you are hungry.

They have outside back patio seating but the last time I was up there it needed a bit of a clean up job. Good staff and perfect location (I can walk there) make it a very nice place for me!
author: Ryan B.

description: Not a bad bar. A lot of cold beers on tap. Kinda divey but good. Awesome beer garden in the back but closes at 8pm
author: Rick W.

description: Lots of games on, decent tap selection, currently they have 7 anchor steam beers which is interesting. Service is so-so, they can't seem to pour a beer without spilling it over the side. They have a grilled ham and cheese sandwich that is actually quite good.
author: Will D.

description:
I love this place because it's a proper pub (a rare thing) within walking distance of my place. Nothing flash, just a decent, spacious place with a lovely back outdoor area, pool tables and a jukebox that has Kenickie on it. Ticks nearly all my boxes!

Plus, the staff are always awesome. They even have free BBQ food on occasion. You can tell this place is great because I still love it even after I had the worst cup of tea of my life there :) (microwaved water and ripped tea-bag, because some of their equipment was not working at the time - I don't hold it against them though!)
author: Annie C.

description: I came here to watch the Big Game a few weeks ago with some friends and was very surprised by this place. It does not look like much on the outside but it's a great bar with a lot of fun people. Atmosphere was fun and the free food was delicious. I definitely will be coming here a lot next season!
author: Tom I.

description:
We stumbled upon this place because we were trying to kill time. We were originally going to have lunch at Hahn's Hibachi but because they aren't clear on what time they are open, we decided to park it here.

Plus, it was Sunday football--I LOVE football. Usually, I watch it at home but it seemed appropriate to watch it here. It was lively and fun! We ordered drinks and ate some free BBQ! Yes! Free BBQ! The staff are very friendly and the drinks are good.

I think I know where I'll find myself on Sundays! :)
author: Mel P.

description:
My girlfriend and I were in Noe Valley on a cold February afternoon and stopped into Valley Tavern to get out of the cold. We've lived in SF for 5-6 years now, but rarely make it out to Noe Valley, but we're glad we did.

The ambiance is exactly what we expected; very pub-like atmosphere with TV's and a pool table. It was warm inside, tons of room to sit at the bar or at a table, and pretty quite for a Sunday afternoon.

She ordered the Bloody Mary and myself a tall Guinness. The bill came to $13, which seems pretty reasonable for SF (I've had $13 bloody mary's in this city to say the least.) Both drinks were delicious and the Bloody Mary was spicy, but not too spicy.

The best part of Valley Tavern is the outdoor seating. They have a three tier outdoor patio area, complete with TV's and heat-lamps. This was ideal for the cold SF day we were caught in the middle of, and since we wanted to watch the Oscar's, the TV's outside were awesome. 

The bartender was super nice and even double checked that we wanted to Bloddy Mary spicy. 

Aesthetics 4/5
Drinks 4/5
Service 5/5
Location 5/5
author: Matthew H.

description:
A lot of good things going on at the tavern.

Showed up on a Sunday afternoon for the Yelp cupcake bakeoff.  I showed up a half hour-early, so I sat down with my lady friend for a quick beer.  Spacious seating, saloon-themed decor with a big beer garden out back (alcoholic beverages not allowed, though -- must be smoking only?).

The tavern had a fairly large tap, I grabbed an Anchor Liberty and Lauren a Blue Moon for $9.50.  We watched a soccer game (loads of TVs) for a while and chatted it up with the friendly bartender.

Two pool tables in back, as well as a pinball machine and some video game cabinet.  Good times to be had at this place; I'd definitely stop by for early evening drinks and pool.
author: Bill H.

description:
Great place.  Awesome variety in their beer selection.  Great sampling of local and some obscure craft beers.  One of my go to bars.  It has an attentive wait staff and is always a good time.

Also a great place to watch a game
author: Rich C.

description:
We were out with my friends and one of our friend's mother who was in town. Eight of the nine of us were still awake and chatting while our friend's mother closed her eyes for 2 minutes. 
The waitress kicked us out when she saw this. What?? We had already bought $60 of drinks, was about ready for the 2nd round, before they kicked us to the curb. 
I won't be coming back. Our group was still awake except for the one older member. Moms want to go to bars, too.
author: Katie H.

description:
This review is getting posted later than it should be. We stumbled in here to catch the end of the Giants Phillies game that happened to be the same night as the Double OT Warriors/Spurs game. 
The place was absolutely packed, yet I was served extremely fast. 
I ordered a Manhattan and Declan (the bartender) made the best Manhattan I'd ever had. Once the placed died down after the games, I chatted him up about it and got his secret. I'd tell you, but then you wouldn't hit Declan up and give him the tip he definitely deserves. 
My wife ordered an Irish Coffee and it wasn't hot. Somehow while it was still packed, they figured it out, found her and replaced it all on their own. My wife didn't want to complain because of how packed the bar was. But after they fixed it she said it was superb.  After the game I ordered another Manhattan because of how good they were and we were only charged for 2 drinks even though we had three. 
They had good selection of beer on tap and there was a crap load of TV's for catching the games. There wasn't a bad seat in the house. You know it's a good place when the cops come in to catch the end of the game and they're welcome with open arms. 
Come for the Manhattan's, stay for the next one! I'll be back.
author: Don P.

description:
I'm not a big fan of bars or "taverns" in Noe Valley. It seems like this place is for locals but everytime I go in it's always dead empty. It's a little pricey, and kinda meh. 

Horrible description but whatever. I do what I want.
author: Lauren S.

description: My friends and I came here before and after eating dinner over at Bacco the previous weekend. Atmosphere is great - good music playing, but not so loud that you have to yell. Surprisingly enough, it was less crowded after we got out of dinner, around 10 PM, than it was before (around 7:30 PM). They've got a huge selection of beer on tap, and it's easy enough to find a table to stand at or a booth to sit down. It was Sweet Sixteen weekend, so college hoops and NBA were on all screens - a solid choice. The gin and tonic that I was ordered was a bit strong on the gin side, which was my only complaint. Otherwise, a very nice bar to relax at...wish there were more places like this in Manhattan...
author: Asuka N.

description:
Living in Noe Valley leaves one with pretty limited options as far as the bar scene goes...  The Mission is just "down the hill"  and definitely is full of fun choices (and more interesting crowds), but sometimes the idea of walking back up that hill/catching a cab makes it just too much of a pain when you just want to grab a quick beer or two.
 
Valley Tavern is a decent option for these times.  The beer selection is good and the bartenders are friendly.  There's even a patio in the back for those cherished warm, sunny San Francisco afternoons.  An extra star for the bar letting you order in food from local restaurants (Paxti's, Noe's Bar, etc...)  to enjoy with your brew...
author: Anne B.

description: Valley Tavern is my favorite neighborhood bar.  Its a great place to hang out as well as catch a game.  Love coming here for a game and getting their Spicy Bloody Mary-its my favorite.  Beer selection is fantastic and the staff is great at handling the crowd and drink orders.
author: Samantha G.

description: Not really my type of scene, but stopped here for drinks last night before dinner in the city. Modest selections of wine, a much larger variety of beers, and a full bar for cocktails. Very generous pour of whiskey in their Irish car bombs (still can't believe I did one, I felt like I was in college again). Very nice bartenders, and not too busy on a Saturday night around 7. ID check at door.
author: Kathy L.

description:
Free BBQ is awesome any day of the week, but on Sunday, when it finally hits you how much you have spent over the course of the week and on Friday and Saturday night...this offer becomes ridiculously awesome!

Plus they have Hoegaarden on tap with the hexagonal pint glasses.

Plus they have approx 10 HD flat screens. For a small place like Valley Tavern, you can literally be sitting everywhere and see all of them.

This place is amazing. I wish it was closer to where I lived. Most definitely worth the trip though. Even though I wouldn't consider it a sports bar, it is better than most sports bars in this freaking city. The people here are super friendly too.

I would give this 6 ****** stars if I could!
author: Jeffrey S.

description:
I've gotta hand it to Valley Tavern  - open bar for two hours on New Year's Eve 2011, for free?????   I couldn't believe it either, until we arrived there and sure enough, the bartenders were essentially handing out drinks to everyone.  Unbelievable!!

Perhaps the even more impressive feat was that somehow the bartenders were keeping up with the demand - not easy considering that half the neighborhood probably showed up here.  I applaud the hard working staff that took the whole event in stride and didn't skip a beat the entire time we were there.

We definitely will return here on a more typical night.  We owe it to Valley Tavern to pay for a drink one of these days!  Great job guys.
author: Tim N.

description:
#1 go-to bar for NFL football Sundays in Noe Valley/Castro area

I don't hang out at the tavern much.  As everyone knows Noe is not well known for its nightlife.  However, you will find me here almost every Sunday for the following reasons:

Crowd.  Very diverse (Ravens, Pats, Eagles, Colts, Giants, Cowboys, Raiders, 49ers) and very friendly atmosphere.

Setup.  Enough HDTV's to follow all the games.  Free wifi for you to check your fantasy score too ;)

Free food.  Not just free, but they are good!  Most Sunday's they will have bangers, hot dogs, louisiana hot links, cheeseburgers and salad.  On some Sundays they will throw in ribs or catered Chinese food.

Beer selection.  About 15 on tap

Staff.  Very friendly even though from time to time can get overwhelmed (for example when Giants are in the playoffs on a Sunday)
author: Andi H.

description:
Valley Tavern is a great place to catch a game.  Here are the facts:

1) Great beer selection

2) No food but you can order from Paxti's (pizza) next door and they will deliver right to your table.

3) Pool table.

4) A bit expensive.  Not for Noe, but certainly compared to the average sports bar in the city.

5) Multilevel outdoor patio and deck area, complete with TV"s and picnic tables.

This is a solid, cozy neighborhood sports bar.  

My is only complaint is that the outdoor area area can attract those cigarette smoking, tequila (love tequila, just not a noon on a Sunday with a marb red) drinking chads that have nothing better do than hate the world around them while slowly killing themselves.  I almost made it the entire year without fantasizing about smashing a bottle on someone's face.  Maybe next year.
author: Johny X.

description: Big place, good for sports and lots of beer on tap.
author: Veronica B.

description:
It's the only place I've been to in Noe Valley. I'm excited to explore the rest of the neighborhood. 
They have friendly bar tenders. There are pool tables, for a buck-twenty-five, WHAAA!?!?!. There is a smoking patio. There are tables to sit at. Some people were watching a game. 

I think it is a cool spot to meet up with friends.
author: David K.

description:
The Tavern is a great neighborhood bar with friendly staff and people with plenty of sports for those that want it. The smoking patio is great if you want it (they've even recently fixed the heat lamp). 

There is also a patio out back that has the beer garden vibe down so take advantage when it's open!
author: Ennis O.

description: Awesome complimentary Sunday night football snacks.
author: Nikki B.

description: Good bar with a nice selection on tap, though they are a little light on dark beers.  I love that they let you bring food in.  I don't love that the smoking section is kinda connected and occasionally you will get a bunch of smoke blowing into the bar.  This isn't a problem towards the back of the bar.  Probably a good bar if you are a smoker though.
author: Paul T.

description: Love this place. Amazing selection of brews, great place to watch a game. Staff is the best ever. Also the soccer team, Totti I think, is super sexy and hot. Especially the guys :) they are there every Thursday
author: Chad J.

description:
Again, a solid bar. I came here during the 1st game of the World Series and it was Packed and Rockin'.

It's a great atmosphere and this is my go-to bar in Noe Valley
author: Eric A.

description: This is my friend's favorite bar.  He lives in Noe Valley and know some of the usuals names by heart.  That makes me wonder if he's a usual too?  We went here for some drinks to waste time while waiting for some people.  The place is a decent size.  I agree, more space in the seating area would be nice, but hey this is SF.  We have to be grateful for what we get.  I need to check out the patio another time.
author: Michelle M.

description: DIVERSE crowd before heading to At@t a lot of Giant apparel. NOT a sniff of Green & Gold.Good Pisco Sour Very inviting wish I lived closer for a place to hang.
author: Mark C.

description:
What Happened Here?
seriously - WTF?
This used to be a good place for a beer and to hang out for awhile.
NOT ANYMORE - this place is horrible, 
CRAPPY MUSIC that's too loud to talk over, flat stale beer, when i took it back (yeah, it was pretty bad) the bartender tried to charge me more for a fresh beer, i actually left with half a beer unfinished. 
Will not go back. 
Ugh.
author: Hans H.

description: Tons of beers on tap. Its a chill area, and a nice atmosphere. Great for a relaxed Saturday night, while still being out.
author: Leslie G.

description: By far the best Bloody Mary's in SF, I get mine extra spicy! The service is also top notch.
author: Nicholas R.

description: This place was a lot of fun. Great bartenders, good selection of beer, and great atmosphere. Highly recommended.
author: Ryan T.

description: Easily the best bar in Noe Valley. Great tap selection and friendly bartenders make this place a regular stomping ground for my friends and I.
author: Mike L.

description:
Nice pub to go to for happy hour.  They have a really nice patio out back but closes around 7:30pm because it's around houses.  If they kept the patio open later I would bump up my rating. 

They also have 2 pool tables inside which are extremely cramped.  I could not hustle people because I didn't have enough room to properly shoot. (JK)
author: Danny P.

description:
Are you headed out for a night on the town with a large group of people, or maybe it's just you and your best friend, oh heck, maybe it's just you!  The Valley Tavern is an amazing place to go after a long workday, or even a long work week.  They have SO many beers and ciders on tap that it makes those of us with decision making problems go absolutely bonkers, in a good way, of course!

In addition to the plethora of beer and ciders available, the bar also features 3-4 flat screen televisions so you can catch a glimpse of your favorite athletes battling it out, a jukebox for your music needs, and a few pool tables in the back for when you and your friends want to get a little competition going.  

Any time I've visited this place I've had  no problem saddling up to the bar and ordering, but there are also tables for small parties and social gatherings if that's more your style.  The bar staff are friendly, when comparing them to other bartenders around the city, and most will sit and have a chat with you if the evening isn't too demanding.
